title: Mage players, what are your plans to sustain your mana with the item changes?
body:
As most of you probably know, Riot is removing mana regen from mages and switching it for small amounts of flat mana (yes 400 mana on morello is small. I'ts like 3-4 spells).

Those changes will make mana sustain almost impossible to get, since the 2 items that sustain mana are now {{item:3010}} {{item:3174}} , both of wich requires you to get damages to activate... I don't understand these changes since most mages actualy want to stay back and avoid damage as much as possible... And switching mana regen to flat mana is a clear nerf to every mages, since a mage WILL get out of mana at one point, and mana is their main ressource... AD can use lifesteal or Essence reaver to sustain, tanks have warmog and don't need that much mana, but mages have no way of sustaining themselves appart from getting hit...

Considering this, what do you fellow mage players think about doing to sustain your mana?

Personnaly, I think I'm gonna straight up go for {{item:3092}} rush... The other option would be {{item:3048}}, wich is basicaly the only way to have a mana pool huge enough to not have to back for a long time, even tought you still will run out of mana at one point, it wil take much longer and the item is going to be straight up stronger than any AP item since flat mana will be everywhere and the passive gives you AP based on your mana. I mainly play {{champion:99}} {{champion:134}} {{champion:61}}, my new build should probably look like

{{item:3048}} OR {{item:3092}} ,  {{item:3165}}, {{item:3135}} , {{item:3157}}, {{item:3020}} ,{{item:3089}}

Unless they make update to all mages mana pool/base mana regen - like, __double__ one them - I don't imagine playing mages anymore at all. 

Regeneration from new Catalyst not only requires you to take solid pounding to have any effect - the numbers are __absurdly__ low compared to old one. If you got old Catalyst on lvl 6, you got 800 mana when you hit lvl 10. Now, to get equivalent of mana from __single__ Valor's Reward proc, you need to take like 1300 damage. I get how they prefer in-combat regen than passive regen, but isn't the point you should get __more__ from it when you take risks, instead of getting __almost nothing__? I.e. ulting lvl 16 Swain will get like 5 HP  every second from new Catalyst. Now compare it to Graves' lifesteal...

This is worse than pathethic. Like I said - I hope Riot will update mana pools accordingly.
